Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that terrorists can easily buy assault weapons, when in reality there are restrictions in place and not all individuals on the terrorist watchlist are terrorists.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that individuals on the no fly list, who are also prohibited from flying, are not necessarily known terrorists but can still pose a threat.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to substantiate the assertion that terrorists can easily buy assault weapons.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a direct comparison between the ability to fly and the ability to buy assault weapons, without considering the different regulations and constitutional rights involved.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that terrorists who have been convicted of a felony or are under indictment cannot legally buy a gun, which contradicts the claim.
